S31640-011_syn_2: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient presented with symptomatic post-tracheostomy sequelae. Upon bronchoscopic evaluation, circumferential mid-tracheal granulation tissue was id[REDACTED], compromising the airway lumen. A strictly mechanical approach was adopted; the tissue was systematically excised utilizing biopsy forceps for piecemeal debridement and a snare for pedunculated elements. No thermal ablative modalities were employed. Hemostasis was achieved via cold saline lavage.

S31640-011_syn_8: The patient arrived for elective bronchoscopy to address chronic cough related to tracheal granulation. Under moderate sedation, we advanced the bronchoscope and visualized the mid-tracheal stenosis. We proceeded to remove the granulation tissue mechanically. S31640-011:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY – MECHANICAL DEBULKING OF TRACHEAL GRANULATION

Patient: [REDACTED], 70-year-old male
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Nina Patel

Indication:
Chronic cough and wheeze from tracheal granulation tissue around an old tracheostomy site, now decannulated.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tracheal granulation tissue (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation (midazolam, fentanyl) and topical lidocaine. Native airway. ASA class II.

Findings:
Irregular granulation tissue circumferentially at the mid-trachea where prior tracheostomy had been, narrowing the lumen to about 60%.

Interventions:
Multiple passes of forceps debulking were performed to remove the granulation tissue in piecemeal fashion. Snare resection was used for a pedunculated portion. The procedure consisted solely of mechanical excision and debulking; no ablation or thermal therapy was delivered.

Hemostasis:
Minor oozing controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5–10 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Observed in recovery and discharged home with inhaled corticosteroid and PPI therapy. Planned surveillance bronchoscopy in 3 months.
